meanings.definition: To feel upset or annoyed by something said or done.
meanings.sent1: She was offended by his rude comment.
meanings.sent2: I don't want to offend anyone with my words.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked offended when I didn't share my food.
meanings.sent4: His actions offended her sense of justice.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's unfairness offended the students.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel upset or annoyed.
meanings.sent2: I hope I didn't offend you with my joke.
meanings.sent3: The dog's refusal to play fetch offended the child.
meanings.sent4: The decision to cancel the event offended many attendees.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech offended a large portion of the audience.
